name: treatment of waste paper, unsorted, sorting | waste paper, sorted | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10033/documentation

This activity represents the treatment of 1 kg waste paper from separate collection, i.e. a source-segregated municipal solid waste fraction, through sorting for recycling. The activity starts with receiving the unsorted waste paper, as collected from the households, at the sorting facility and ends when sorted fractions are produced. 

The activity starts with "waste paper, unsorted" being available to the sorting facility.

The activity ends with "waste paper, unsorted" being sorted and "waste paper, sorted" available for transportation at the gate of the sorting facility.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data mainly reflecting situation in Switzerland in 2012.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data are sourced from plants located or activities taking place in Switzerland and/or relevant literature sources.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Technology encountered in Switzerland for the underlying time frame.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The activity ‘treatment of waste paper, unsorted, sorting {CH}’ available in v3.3 was used as the starting point for this activity, assuming that the energy need, auxiliary materials and waste content were similar. However, all the waste material flows were replaced with the values reported in the material flow analysis by Haupt et al. (2017).

exchanges.description: Exchange modelled based on previous versions of this dataset in the ecoinvent database, i.e. in v2: waste paper, sorted, for further treatment, CH, and; in v3 (up until 3.6): treatment of waste paper, unsorted, sorting, CH
Input of metal working modelled as a service with an activity link to the supplying activity of matching/overlapping geography.
